data.title: University of Michigan Athletics
data.meta_description: Brad Robbins (91) P - CAREER GAME-BY-GAME STATISTICS CAREER BESTS Punting • Punts: 9 - (2X) last at Wisconsin (Nov. 18, 2017) • Yards: 375 - at Indiana (Nov....
data.text:
CAREER GAME-BY-GAME STATISTICS

CAREER BESTS

Punting

• Punts: 9 - (2X) last at Wisconsin (Nov. 18, 2017)

• Yards: 375 - at Indiana (Nov. 7, 2020)

• Average: 54.2 - at Penn State (Nov. 13, 2021)

• I-20: 4 - (2X), last at Indiana (Nov. 7, 2020)

• Long: 66 - at Indiana (Nov. 7, 2020)

At Michigan

• Three-time All-Big Ten honoree (honorable mention, coaches, 2017, 2020-21; media, 2020-21)

• The program's only two-time recipient of the Robert P. Ufer Bequest (2021, '22)

• Finished his career with the No. 2 career punting average (42.0 yards per attempt) and No. 2 single-season average (46.33) in program history; fifth in total punt yards (7,698)

• Has appeared in 44 career games during his career

• Five-year letterman (2017, '19-20-21-22)

• Two-time Academic All-Big Ten honoree (2021, '22)

• Missed the entire 2018 season and the start of 2019 due to an injury

Graduate Student (2022)

• Started as the team's punter and holder in all 14 games (punted in 13 contests); punted 43 times for 1,818 yards with a 64-yard long, 21 fair catches forced, 16 punts inside the 20-yard line and nine at 50-plus yards to earn his fifth varsity letter

• For the second time, was named the recipient of of the Robert P. Ufer Bequest

• On three occasions, shared Special Teams Player of the game honors for his performances against Michigan State, Illinois, at Iowa

• Named Special Teams Player of the Week for his performance against Nebraska

• Punted twice against Colorado State (Sept, 3), with no return yards allowed and two inside the 20-yard line, including a 51-yard long

• On four punts, allowed no return yards with one inside the 20 against Hawaii (Sept. 10)

• Drilled both punts against UConn (Sept. 17), at 53 and 62 yards, pinning one at the four-yard line

• Punted three times with two inside the 20-yard line against Maryland (sept. 24), including a 54-yard long

• Shared Special Teams Player of the Week honors for his performance against Maryland

• Punted four times with two inside the 20 and two over 50 yards at Iowa (Oct. 1)

• Punted three times including a 58-yard long at Indiana (Oct. 8)

• Held on seven field goal and PATs against Penn State (Oct. 15) but did not punt

• Held on seven field goals and PATs against Michigan State (Oct. 29) and punted once for 34 yards with a fair catch induced

• Punted three times totaling 130 yards at Rutgers (Nov. 5)

• Against Nebraska (Nov. 12), punted three times for 119 yards with one inside the 20-yard line

• Held the game-winning kick among four field goals against Illinois (Nov. 19) and punted four times with one inside the 20

• Averaged over 40 yards per boot on five punts at Ohio State (Nov. 26), forcing five fair catches

• Punted four times for 164 yards with no return yards allowed against Purdue in the Big Ten Championship (Dec. 3)

• Totaled 223 yards on five punts against TCU in the Vrbo Fiesta Bowl/CFP Semifinal (Dec. 31), with three inside the 20 and a 64-yard long

Graduate Student (2021)

• Handled the team's punting and place holding duties in all 14 games, totaling 45 punts for 2,085 yards (46.3 average), the No. 2 single-season average in program history, with 21 forced fair catches, 17 punts inside the 20 and 12 at 50 yards or longer

• All-Big Ten selection (honorable mention, coaches and media)

• Ray Guy Award semifinalist

• Named part of the Ray Guy Award 'Ray's 8' after his performances at Wisconsin, at Nebraska

• Twice Named Co-Special Teams Player of the Week for his performances against Washington, at Nebraska

• Holder for field goals and PATs, punted twice for 87 yards with one inside the 20 against Western Michigan (Sept. 4)

• Delivered four punts for 184 yards with a 59-yard long against Washington (Sept. 11)

• Held on field goals but did not need to punt against Northern illinois (Sept. 18)

• Totaled 204 yards on five punts with a 51-yard long and two inside the 20 against Rutgers (Sept. 25)

• Averaged 44.8 yards on four punts with three inside the 20, pinning two inside the yard line at Wisconsin (Oct. 2)

• Drilled three of four punts over 50 yards with a 57-yard long, pinning three inside the 20 and two inside the 10-yard line at Nebraska (Oct. 9)

• Punted three times against Northwestern (Oct. 23) with a 48-yard long

• Punted twice, landing both inside the 20-yard line at Michigan State (Oct. 30)

• Against Indiana (Nov. 6), punted four times with a 54-yard long and no return yards allowed

• Punted five times with a 52.4-yard-avaerage at Penn State (Nov.13) with a season-best 65-yarder

• Punted three times for 136 yards with two inside the 20-yard line at Maryland (Nov. 20)

• Punted twice against Ohio State (Nov. 27), putting one inside the five-yard line

• On five punts against Iowa in the Big Ten Championship Game (Dec. 4), average 51.0 yards per attempt with a 64-yard long

Senior (2020)

• Appeared in five games, punting in all five; punted 23 times for 1,041 yards with a long of 66 yards and a 45.3-yard average to earn his third varsity letter

• All-Big Ten selection (honorable mention, coaches and media)

• Punted four times against Michigan State (Oct. 31) and placed three inside the 10-yard line

• Had a career afternoon at Indiana (Nov. 7), punting seven times for a 53.6-yard average, the third-highest single-game mark in Michigan history (minimum, 3 attempts), with four inside the opponent's 20 and long punts of 65 and 66 yards

• Punted five times against Wisconsin (Nov. 14) with a 47-yard long in windy and rainy conditions

• Totaled 137 yards on three punts at Rutgers (Nov. 21)

• Forced three fair catches and pinned one punt inside the 20 on four attempts against Penn State (Nov. 28)

Junior (2019)

• Appeared in two games; punted four times for 171 yards to earn his second varsity letter

• Made his season debut against Ohio State (Nov. 30), totaling 171 yards on four punts with one inside the 20-yard line

• Registered a punt against Alabama in the Vrbo Citrus Bowl (Jan. 1), but it was blocked

Sophomore (2018)

• Did not see game action

Freshman (2017)

• Played in 10 games with 64 punts for a total of 2,583 yards (40.4 average), with 19 inside the opponent’s 20-yard line and earned his first varsity letter

• All-Big Ten honoree (honorable mention, coaches)

• Made his debut at Purdue (Sept. 23), averaging 40.6 yards per kick over seven punts with a long of 45

• Punted seven times against Michigan State (Oct. 7) with a 42.57-yard average and a career-long of 57

• Punted a career-high nine times at Indiana (Oct. 14), totaling 367 yards for a 40.8-yard average with three inside the 20-yard line, and forced four fair catches

• Punted six times for a total of 233 yards at Penn State (Oct. 21), with one inside the 20 and two forced fair catches

• Against Rutgers (Oct. 28), punted three times for 125 total yards with two inside the 20, forcing two fair catches to allow zero total return yards

• Amassed 204 yards on five punts (40.8 average) against Minnesota (Nov. 4), allowing 0 return yards with three forced fair catches and two inside the 20-yard line

• Punted five times for 212 yards (41.8 average) at Maryland (Nov. 11), with one touchback and two fair catches forced, allow- ing 0 total return yards for the second week in a row

• Matched his career high with nine punts at Wisconsin (Nov. 18), amassing 363 total yards with a 40.4-yard average and a long of 52, putting four punts inside the Badgers' 20, and one more at the 20-yard line, with separate punts downed at the 6 and 3-yard lines

• Punted seven times against Ohio State (Nov. 25), totaling 288 yards (41.1 average) with a season-long 58-yarder, placing two inside the 20 with another two touchbacks and two fair catches forced

• Punted six times for 209 total yards in the Outback Bowl against South Carolina (Jan. 1), with a long of 45

Prep

• Attended Westerville South High School coached by Kyle Stout

Key Statistics

• Average charted punting distance of 41 yards with an average hang time of 4.36 seconds

• At Kohl's Kicking 2017 Senior Showcase, Robbins averaged over 5.0 seconds on his charts with several 5.2+ second punts

• Scored a touchdown on a 90-yard run off a punt against Olentangy Orange

• From sophomore to senior year, averaged more than 40 yards per punt

Honors and Rankings

• Rated as the nation's No. 1 punter according to Kornblue Kicking

• Listed as the No. 3 punter in the nation by ProKicker.com

• Ranked as Kohl's Kicking's No. 4 punter in the nation

• Top national 2017 Punting Prospect by The Kicking Coach, Filip Filopovic

• Top-rated punter in the state of Ohio

• Earned Punting Champion at 2016 Kornblue Fall Kicking Challenge

• Ray Guy Prokicker.com Top Prospect Award

• Two-star prospect according to 247Sports, the nation's No. 13 punter and No. 129 overall player in the state of Ohio

• Three-time All-Central District punter and all-conference selection

• Other Sports: earned all-conference in soccer and baseball

Personal

• Bradley Robbins was born October 6, 1998

• Played soccer, football, basketball, and baseball through his junior year, earning all-conference honors in soccer and baseball

• Enrolled in the College of Literature, Science and the Arts, majoring in psychology with a minor in entrepreneurship
